metadata.title: Assessment Plan for Red Hat Device Edge based on ISA/IEC 62443-4-2 (SL-4 Target)

components.title: Red Hat Device Edge (MicroShift on RHEL for Edge)
components.description: The target of this assessment is the production Red Hat Device Edge deployment for industrial control.

parts.name: rules-of-engagement
parts.prose: This assessment will be conducted during normal business hours. No disruptive testing will be performed without prior written consent from the system owner.

control-selections.description: All controls implemented by the Red Hat Device Edge component.

assessment-subjects.description: The Red Hat Device Edge instances.

assessment-assets.description: The assets used to perform this assessment.

tasks.title: Assess FR 1: Identification and Authentication Control
Assess FR 6: Timely Response to Events

activities.title: Verify Human User Identification and Authentication
activities.description: Verify that the edge device is configured to uniquely identify and authenticate all human users with MFA.

steps.description: Examine the Image Builder blueprint for the RHEL for Edge image to confirm that SSSD is configured for host-level authentication against an enterprise IdP that enforces MFA.
Examine the GitOps repository for the MicroShift configuration to confirm that the API server is configured to use an OIDC provider that enforces MFA.
Test the login process by attempting to SSH into a target device and by using `kubectl` to access the MicroShift API. Verify that an MFA challenge is presented for both.

activities.title: Verify Authenticator Management
activities.description: Verify that secrets and keys are protected by a hardware-level TPM.

steps.description: Examine the Image Builder blueprint to confirm that the filesystem configuration specifies LUKS disk encryption bound to a TPM 2.0 device.

activities.title: Verify Authorization Enforcement and Dual Approval
activities.description: Verify that authorization is enforced via RBAC and that all changes require dual approval via a GitOps workflow.

steps.description: Examine the branch protection rules on the Git repository that manages the edge device configurations. Verify that all merges to the main branch require at least one peer review and approval.
Examine the RBAC manifests in the Git repository to confirm that administrative privileges are granted to groups, not individual users.
Test the workflow by submitting a pull request with a configuration change and verifying that it cannot be merged without approval from a second, authorized user.

activities.title: Verify Mobile Code Control
activities.description: Verify that only signed container images from trusted sources can be deployed.

steps.description: Examine the MicroShift configuration in the GitOps repository to confirm that an admission controller is configured to validate container image signatures.

activities.title: Verify Protection from Malicious Code
activities.description: Verify that the device uses an immutable OS with SELinux in enforcing mode.

steps.description: Test the device by running `rpm-ostree status` to verify the immutability of the base OS.
Test the device by running `sestatus` to verify that SELinux is in 'enforcing' mode.

activities.title: Verify Software and Information Integrity
activities.description: Verify the integrity of the OS and applications.

steps.description: Examine the Image Builder blueprint to confirm that IMA/EVM is enabled for the OS image build.
Examine the GitOps repository to confirm that all application manifests specify container images with a cryptographic digest, not just a tag.

activities.title: Verify Use of Cryptography
activities.description: Verify that the device is running in FIPS mode.

steps.description: Examine the Image Builder blueprint to confirm that FIPS mode is enabled for the OS image.
Test a running device by checking `/proc/sys/crypto/fips_enabled` and verifying its value is '1'.

activities.title: Verify Network Segmentation
activities.description: Verify that the host firewall and Kubernetes NetworkPolicies are configured.

steps.description: Examine the Image Builder blueprint to confirm that `firewalld` is configured with a default-deny policy.
Examine the NetworkPolicy manifests in the GitOps repository to confirm that a default-deny ingress policy is applied to all application namespaces.

activities.title: Verify Continuous Monitoring
activities.description: Verify that a monitoring agent is active and forwarding logs.

steps.description: Examine the Image Builder blueprint to confirm that a monitoring agent and log forwarder (`rsyslog`) are included in the OS image and configured to point to a central SIEM.

activities.title: Verify Denial of Service Protection
activities.description: Verify that resource limits are configured for applications.

steps.description: Examine the ResourceQuota and LimitRange manifests in the GitOps repository to confirm that CPU and memory limits are defined for all application namespaces.

activities.title: Verify Network and Security Configuration Settings
activities.description: Verify that the entire device configuration is managed as code.

steps.description: Examine the Git repository that manages the edge device and verify that it contains both the Image Builder blueprint for the OS and the Kubernetes manifests for the runtime applications.

activities.title: Verify Control System Component Inventory
activities.description: Verify that a software inventory is available.

steps.description: Test the device by running `rpm-ostree status` to get the OS version and `kubectl get pods -A` to list all running software components.
